intro: Manglietia garrettii, commonly known as the pink manglietia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its striking pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has broad, leathery leaves and produces a unique, fragrant scent that attracts pollinators. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
